SEARCH
Package gw.api.heatmap

Class HeatMapCacheBase<K,V>

java.lang.Object
gw.api.heatmap.HeatMapCacheBase<K,V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
HeatMapCache<K,V>
public abstract class HeatMapCacheBase<K,V> extends Object implements HeatMapCache<K,V>
Abstract superclass for HeatMapCache implementations. Most HeatMapCache implementers should use this superclass as it handles the threading and refreshing issues automatically. The subclasser just has to override the load(Object) method which is called to actually load the value for a given key.

  • Constructor Details

    • HeatMapCacheBase

      protected HeatMapCacheBase(long refreshIntervalMillis)
      Initialize cache with given refresh interval
      Parameters:
      refreshIntervalMillis - the interval at which any previously loaded values will be automatically refreshed

  • Method Details

    • getEntry

      public HeatMapCacheEntry<K,V> getEntry(K key)
      Get the entry associated with the given key; will create an entry if one does not already exist. The entry can be used to load the associated value or to examine the current cache state for the given key. A particular cache will only ever return one entry for a particular key. Getting an entry is a cheap and non blocking operation.
      Specified by:
      getEntry in interface HeatMapCache<K,V>
      Parameters:
      key - a non null key
      Returns:
      a non null entry

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Called when the cache is being shut down - typically when the entire server is being shut down. Releases any resources used by the cache and ensures that any future attempts to load data will throw an IllegalStateException. This method should not be called unless the cache is never to be used again.
      Specified by:
      shutdown in interface HeatMapCache<K,V>

    • load

      protected abstract V load(K key)
      Responsibility for subclassers; load the value for the given key
      Parameters:
      key - the key for the value to be loaded
      Returns:
      the newly loaded value
